text: Ramapo is a town in Rockland County, New York, United States. It was originally formed as New Hampstead, in 1791."Ramapo", in Peter R. Eisenstadt and Laura-Eve Moss (Eds.), The Encyclopedia of New York State. Syracuse, NY: Syracuse University Press. . p. 1284. It shares its name with the Ramapo River. As of the 2020 census, Ramapo had a total population of 148,919. ==References== Category:Towns in New York (state) Category:1791 establishments in New York (state)
title: Ramapo, New York
